definition[0]: to not include someone or something
example[0]: She outlined the case to him, being careful not to leave anything out.
example[1]: Kidd has been left out of the team.
definition[1]: to feel that you are not accepted or welcome in a situation
example[2]: New fathers often feel left out when baby arrives.
definition[2]: used to tell someone to stop lying, pretending, or being annoying
